Background


Bengaluru, a major Indian city, has experienced a fast urban growth in recent years. This has lead to a substantial demand for dairy products, met in part by urban and peri-urban dairy producers. A study was held which aimed to investigate the urbanisation's effects on dairy production and find key characteristics of dairy systems along Bengaluru's rural-urban boundary.


The survey involved 337 dairy producers and explored aspects such as their household's socio-economic status, dairy herd management, available resources, and involvement in input and output markets. The data provided gives the responses to this survey.


Reference: Reichenbach, M., Pinto, A., König, S., Bhatta, R. and Schlecht, E., 2021. Dairy production in an urbanizing environment—Typology and linkages in the megacity of Bengaluru, India. PLoS One, 16(8), p.e0255791.
